text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with basil peach black pepper
Parmesan cobbler I know it sounds
completely wacky but it was unbelievably
delicious and you're going to have to go
read the blog post where I explain the
craziness but here is how I did it I
started with two ramekins I'm doing this
as sort of individual portions you can
even do for smaller ones if you wanted
or you could do one large cobbler like
we demoed before so I'm going to put
some butter in each one microwave it for
just a few seconds till it melts so
that's going to be at the bottom of our
little ramekins and then we're basically
going to make the same cobbler batter as
you saw in our regular peach cobbler
video which is basically sugar
self-rising flour all right we'll talk
about that on the blog - self rising
flour I'm going to mix that up and then
we're going to add some cold milk and
we're going to stir that - a perfect
batter consistency okay so that would be
regular cobbler batter but we're going
to go a little crazy and add some
Parmesan cheese and black pepper believe
it or not so one of the influences for
this dessert is the gorge air which
we've demoed before which is like an

puff dough basically which I love so I'm
going to add a little bit of cheese and
a little bit of black pepper stir that
in or if anyone's ever had a fruit and
cheese danish very delicious so mixing
cheese with fruit not really that crazy
all right we're going to divide that
into into our two ramekins just right on

water just so it makes a little bit more
CERP alright we're going to mix that up
and I'm gonna let that sit about ten
minutes just so that sugar draws out a
little bit
of moisture and gives us a little more

so after sat for a while I went ahead
and I divided my sliced peaches between
the two ramekins which was about five or
six slices each just putting it right on
top of that batter in the butter and
like a regular cobbler that batter is
going to cook and come up over the top
I'm going to put those on a baking sheet
and I apologize I did not show the old

alright we'll do two next time those are
going to go in a preheated 375 degree

it's going to depend on the size of
